meanings.definition: To move with short sliding steps without lifting the feet completely off the ground.
meanings.sent1: The kids were shuffling around the room during the game.
meanings.sent2: She was shuffling her cards before dealing them out.
meanings.sent3: The penguins were shuffling around the ice, trying to find the best fishing spot.
meanings.sent4: The leaves were shuffling in the wind, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The old man was shuffling slowly across the park, enjoying the fresh air.

meanings.definition: To mix up or rearrange in a haphazard manner.
meanings.sent1: He was shuffling the papers on his desk to find the right document.
meanings.sent2: The chef was shuffling the ingredients to create a new recipe.
meanings.sent3: The monkeys were shuffling the branches, causing a mess in the jungle.
meanings.sent4: The wind was shuffling the fallen leaves, creating a colorful carpet.
meanings.sent5: She was shuffling the puzzle pieces, trying to solve the mystery.

meanings.definition: A dragging or scraping noise made by dragging one's feet while walking.
meanings.sent1: The shuffling of his slippers echoed in the quiet hallway.
meanings.sent2: She could hear the shuffling of feet behind her in the dark alley.
meanings.sent3: The shuffling of the cards signaled the start of the card game.
meanings.sent4: The shuffling of the leaves underfoot added to the autumn ambiance.
meanings.sent5: The shuffling of the dancers' feet added rhythm to the music.
